- That data, sourced to a third-party vendor, alarmed a spokesperson for the Florida Democrats. Reference: https://floridapolitics.com/archives/562088-email-insights-desantis-country/ published on 2022-10-06 18:30:22
correction_response: This tweet is somewhat misleading. While it's true that Florida schools require female student-athletes to report their menstrual history, it's not specifically Ron DeSantis who wants this information. The practice has been established in Florida schools and the data is sourced to a third-party vendor, which has raised concerns among some. The fear is that this data could potentially be used to restrict reproductive freedoms. https://floridapolitics.com/archives/562088-email-insights-desantis-country/
note_1_text: Mandatory submission of menstrual history is an initiative of the Florida High School Athletics Association (FHSAA). https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/florida-athletes-menstrual-periods/    The Governor does not appoint members of the FHSAA Board of Directors, Representative Assembly, Committees, or Advisory Committees. https://fhsaa.com/sports/2020/1/28/Governance.aspx
note_2_text: Missing important context: A question on menstrual status of female student athletes has been an optional part of sports medicine questionnaires for over 20 years. It's not something added by the DeSantis administration.    https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/florida-athletes-menstrual-periods/
